main event: A witness observed an unidentified object in the sky over Vandalia, Ohio on May 3, 1962.
interesting points: The object remained quite stationary and silent while observed,The witness was unable to determine its exact size or shape, but noted it seemed larger than an average star,There were periods during the sighting when the object was obscured by clouds,The witness reported that the object appeared to be bright silver and shiny,The witness estimated the speed of the object to be faster than a jet.
sighted object: an unidentified bright silver shiny object
witness description: The witness had observed the object while looking at the sky.
